1.text: And concerning the collection for the holy ones, as I appointed to the churches of Galatia, so also do ye.

2.text: According to one day of the sabbaths let each of you put by himself, treasuring up that which he is prospered in, that when I come there be no collections.

3.text: And when I be present, whom ye approve by letters, these will I send to carry your grace to Jerusalem.

4.text: And if it be suitable for me also to go, they shall go with me.

5.text: And I will come to you, when I pass through Macedonia: for I do pass through Macedonia.

6.text: And perhaps with you I shall abide, or also pass the winter, that ye might send me forward wherever I go.

7.text: For I will not see you now in coming forward; but I hope to remain some time with you, if the Lord permit.

8.text: And I will remain in Ephesus even till Pentecost.

9.text: For a door has stood open to me, great and effective, and many opposed.

10.text: And if Timotheus come, see ye that he be with you fearlessly: for he works the work of the Lord, as I also.

11.text: Therefore no one should despise him: and send ye him forward in peace, that he might come to me: for I expect him with the brethren.

12.text: And concerning Apollos, the brother, I besought him much that he would come to you with the brethren: and the will was not altogether that he should come now; and he will come when he should have leisure.

13.text: Watch ye, stand in the faith, be manly, be strengthened.

14.text: Let all things be in love.

15.text: And I beseech you brethren, (ye know the house of Stephanas, that it is the first fruits of Achaia, and they arranged themselves for service to the holy ones,)

16.text: That also ye be subjected to such, and to every one cooperating, and to the wearied.

17.text: And I rejoice at the arrival of Stephanas and Fortunatus and: that they have filled up your necessity.

18.text: For they refreshed my spirit and yours: therefore observe ye such.

19.text: The churches of Asia greet you. Aquila and Priscilla, with the church at their house, greet you.

20.text: All the brethren greet you. Greet ye one another with a holy kiss.

21.text: The greeting of Paul by my hand.

22.text: If any love not the Lord Jesus Christ, let him be Anathema Maranatha.

23.text: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ with you:

24.text: My love with you all in Christ Jesus. Amen.
